questions.question: What does DOM stand for?
Which keyword is used to declare a variable in JavaScript?
What is the result of 10 + '5' in JavaScript?
How do you check the data type of a variable in JavaScript?
Which function is used to print something in the console?
What is the purpose of the 'this' keyword in JavaScript?
How do you comment out multiple lines in JavaScript?
Which built-in method returns the length of a string in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of the 'let' keyword in JavaScript?
options: Declares a variable with block scope
Declares a variable with global scope
Declares a variable with function scope
questions.correctAnswer: Declares a variable with block scope

questions.question: What is a closure in JavaScript?
options: A way to close a program
A function with access to variables from its outer scope
questions.correctAnswer: A function with access to variables from its outer scope

What does JSON stand for?
What is the purpose of the 'async' keyword in JavaScript?
options: To handle errors in a function

What does the 'NaN' acronym stand for?
How do you convert a string to a number in JavaScript?
Which event is triggered when a user clicks on an HTML element?
What is the purpose of the 'try...catch' statement in JavaScript?
What is the role of the 'break' statement in a switch statement?
options: To continue to the next case

questions.question: Which method is used to remove the last element from an array in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of the 'const' keyword in JavaScript?
options: To declare a variable with block scope
To declare a variable with global scope
To declare a variable with function scope

questions.question: Which object is used for asynchronous programming in JavaScript?
What does the 'prototype' property do in JavaScript?
options: Adds properties and methods to an object
Defines the type of an object
questions.correctAnswer: Adds properties and methods to an object

questions.question: How do you declare a function in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of the 'Array.isArray()' method in JavaScript?
options: To check if a variable is an object
To check if a variable is a function
To check if a variable is an array
To check if a variable is a string
questions.correctAnswer: To check if a variable is an array

questions.question: Which method is used to join elements of an array into a string?
What is the purpose of the 'localStorage' object in JavaScript?
options: To store data temporarily during a session
To store data permanently on the server
To store data permanently on the client
To store data in the cache
questions.correctAnswer: To store data permanently on the client

questions.question: What does the 'script' tag do in HTML when referring to an external JavaScript file?
options: Links to an external JavaScript file
questions.correctAnswer: Links to an external JavaScript file

questions.question: How do you create a new object in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of the 'map()' method in JavaScript?
options: To iterate over elements of an array
To create a new array with the results of a function
To check if an element exists in an array
To filter elements of an array
questions.correctAnswer: To create a new array with the results of a function
